gas.eg: Oxygen, hydrogen, and nitrogen are all gases.

gas.eng_def: a substance in a form like air that is used as a fuel for heating and cooking
gas.eg: Do you prefer cooking with electricity or gas?

gas.eng_def: a substance in a form like air used for medical purposes to prevent people feeling pain or being conscious during an operation
gas.eg: I had/was given gas when I had my wisdom teeth taken out.

gas.eng_def: air in the bowels or in a baby's stomach, especially when this makes you feel uncomfortable or makes noises
a liquid obtained from petroleum, used especially as a fuel for cars, aircraft, and other vehicles
gas.eg: I'll stop and get some gas - we're running low.

gas.eng_def: the part of a car that you push with your foot to make it go faster
gas.eg: Step on the gas (= drive faster)!

gas.chi_def: 有趣的情形，令人愉快的場面；有趣的事
gas.eg: Some kids put on a show for the moms and dads, - it was a gas.

gas.eng_def: to kill or injure a person by making them breathe poisonous gas
gas.chi_def: 用毒氣殺死，用毒氣殺傷
gas.eg: Hundreds of thousands of soldiers were gassed in the First World War.

gas.eng_def: to talk for a long time about things that are not important
gas.eg: Susan came round and we sat gassing for hours.

gasp.eng_def: to take a short, quick breath through the mouth, especially because of surprise, pain, or shock
gasp.chi_def: （尤指由於驚奇、痛苦或震驚而）喘息，喘氣，倒抽氣
gasp.eg: When she saw the money hidden in the box she gasped in surprise.

gasp.eng_def: to breathe loudly and with difficulty, trying to get more air
gasp.chi_def: （大聲、帶有困難地）喘氣，上氣不接下氣
gasp.eg: He pulled her aboard the boat and she sprawled on the deck, coughing and gasping for breath.
He gave a gasp of amazement.

gate.eng_def: a part of a fence or outside wall that is fixed at one side and opens and closes like a door, usually made of metal or wooden strips
gate.chi_def: （通常由金屬條或木頭條板做的）大門，柵欄門，圍牆門

gate.eng_def: a similar device that slides across an opening, often folding into a smaller space as it is opened
gate.chi_def: （可滑動伸縮的）推拉門，活動門，捲簾門
gate.eg: The lift won't move if the safety gate isn't shut properly.

gate.eng_def: a part of an airport where travellers are allowed to get on or off a particular aircraft
gate.eg: All passengers for flight LH103 please proceed to gate 16.

gate.eng_def: the number of people that go to see a sports event or other large event, or the amount of money people pay to see it
gate.eg: Gates at matches were lower than average last season.

gate.eng_def: used in combination with other nouns to create a name for a situation that causes public shock or disapproval:
gate.eg: a political scandal known as "furgate", in which high-ranking government officials were given expensive coats

gather.eng_def: to collect several things, often from different places or people
gather.eg: I went to several libraries to gather information about the plans.

gather.eng_def: to put your arms around someone and hold or carry them in a careful or loving way
gather.eg: He gathered her in his arms and kissed her.

gather.chi_def: 加快速度／加大力量／勢頭增強（等等）
gather.eg: The bicycle gathered speed as it went down the hill.

gather.eng_def: to prepare to make a great effort to be strong or brave
gather.eg: I spent a week gathering the courage to say no.

gather.eng_def: When people or animals gather, they come together in a group.
gather.eg: A crowd had gathered to hear her speak.

gather.eng_def: to understand or believe something as a result of something that has been said or done
gather.eg: Harry loves his new job, I gather.

gather.eng_def: to pull cloth into small folds by sewing a thread through it and then pulling the thread tight
If you gather a piece of clothing or loose cloth around yourself, you pull it close to your body.
gather.eg: She shivered, and gathered the blanket around her.

gather.eng_def: a small fold that has been sewn into cloth
gather.eg: a skirt with gathers at the back

gathering.eng_def: a party or a meeting when many people come together as a group
gathering.eg: There will be a gathering of world leaders in Vienna next month.

gay.eng_def: sexually attracted to people of the same sex and not to people of the opposite sex

gay.eg: We had a gay old time down at the dance hall.

gay.eng_def: If a place is gay, it is bright and attractive.
gay.chi_def: 五光十色的；鮮艶的；吸引人的
gay.eg: The streets were gay and full of people.

gay.chi_def: 品質差的；愚蠢的；沒有意義的；不合適的

gay.eng_def: a gay person, especially a man

gaze.eng_def: to look at something or someone for a long time, especially in surprise or admiration, or because you are thinking about something else
gaze.chi_def: （尤指因為驚奇、羡慕或心不在焉而）凝視，注視，盯著看
gaze.eg: Annette gazed admiringly at Warren as he spoke.

gaze.eng_def: a long look, usually of a particular kind

gear.eng_def: a device, often consisting of connecting sets of wheels with teeth (= points) around the edge, that controls how much power from an engine goes to the moving parts of a machine
gear.eg: Does your car have five or six gears?

gear.eng_def: the equipment, clothes, etc. that you use to do a particular activity
gear.chi_def: （從事某活動的）裝備，用具，衣服

gear.eg: She wears all the latest gear.
The traffickers knew that there would always be someone willing to move the gear.

gender.eng_def: the physical and/or social condition of being male or female
gender.eg: Does this test show the gender of the baby?

gender.eng_def: all males, or all females, considered as one group
gender.eg: I think both genders are capable of taking care of children.

gender.eng_def: the grammatical arrangement of nouns, pronouns and adjectives into masculine, feminine, and neuter types in some languages
gender.chi_def: 性（一些語言將名詞、代詞和形容詞分為陽性、陰性和中性的文法形式）

gene.eng_def: a part of the DNA in a cell that controls the physical development, behaviour, etc. of an individual plant or animal and is passed on from its parents
gene.eg: The illness is believed to be caused by a defective gene.

general.eng_def: involving or relating to most or all people, things, or places, especially when these are considered as a unit
general.eg: The general feeling is that justice was not served.

general.chi_def: 一般來説；通常；在一般情況下
general.eg: In general, men are taller than women.

general.eng_def: considering the whole of someone or something, and not just a particular part of him, her, or it
general.eg: So, apart from the bad ankle, how are you in general?

general.eng_def: to be a good thing for the public
general.chi_def: 對大多數人有好處；符合公眾利益
general.eg: The government will only say it is not in the general interest to reveal any more information.

general.eng_def: not detailed, but including the most basic or necessary information
general.eg: What he said was very general.

general.eng_def: things considered as a unit and without giving attention to details
general.chi_def: 一般事物；大致情況，總體情況
general.eg: His book moves from the general to the particular.

general.eng_def: including a lot of things or subjects and not limited to only one or a few
general.chi_def: 一般的；普通的；非專門的

general.eng_def: used as part of the title of a job of someone who is in charge of a whole organization or company
general.chi_def: （用於頭銜中，表示負責整個組織或公司）總管的，首席的，全面負責的

general.eng_def: an officer of very high rank, especially in the army
general.eg: He was promoted to the rank of general.

generalize.eng_def: to say or write that something is true all of the time, when it is only true some of the time
generalize.eg: You can't generalize about a continent as varied as Europe.

generate.eg: Her latest film has generated a lot of interest/excitement.

generate.eng_def: to produce energy in a particular form
generate.chi_def: （以某種形式）産生，發生（能量等）
generate.eg: The wind farm may be able to generate enough electricity/power for 2,000 homes.

generation.eng_def: all the people of about the same age within a society or within a particular family
generation.chi_def: （社會或家庭的）一代（人），同代人，同輩人
generation.eg: The younger generation smokes less than their parents did.

generation.eng_def: a period of about 25 to 30 years, in which most human babies become adults and have their own children
generation.chi_def: （時間跨度為23至30年左右的）一代，一輩
generation.eg: A generation ago, home computers were virtually unknown.

generation.eng_def: used to describe the nationality of someone belonging to the first, second, third, etc. group of people of the same age in the family to have been born in that country
generation.chi_def: （一個家庭取得一個國家國籍後在該國家的）第一代／第二代／第三代（等等）
generation.eg: She's a first-generation American (= she was born and raised in the US, but her parents were not).

generation.eng_def: the production of energy in a particular form
generation.eg: electricity generation from wind and wave power

generation.eng_def: a group of products or machines that are all at the same stage of development
generation.eg: a new generation of low-fat margarines

generator.eng_def: a machine that produces electrical power
generator.eg: The hospital's emergency generators are designed to cope with power cuts.

generator.eng_def: a machine or device that produces something
a company or organization that produces something
generator.eg: The two major electricity generators declined to comment.

generosity.eng_def: the quality or condition of being generous
generosity.eg: Her friends take advantage of (= benefit unfairly from) her generosity.

generous.eng_def: willing to give money, help, kindness, etc., especially more than is usual or expected
generous.chi_def: （尤指超乎一般或期望地）慷慨的，大方的；寬宏大量的，仁慈的
（尤指超過一般預期）大的；大量的；豐富的

genetic.eng_def: belonging or relating to genes (= parts of the DNA in cells) received by each animal or plant from its parents

genetics.eng_def: the study of how, in all living things, the characteristics and qualities of parents are given to their children by their genes

genius.eng_def: very great and rare natural ability or skill, especially in a particular area such as science or art, or a person who has this
genius.chi_def: （尤指在某科學或藝術領域中的）天賦，天資；天才，天才人物

genius.eng_def: a person who has a strong bad influence over other people
genius.chi_def: 對別人產生嚴重壞影響的人
genius.eg: The film was about an evil genius who wanted to control the world.

genius.eng_def: to be especially skilled at a particular activity
genius.eg: She has a genius for raising money.

gentle.eg: The path has a gentle slope/gradient.

gentleman.eng_def: a polite way of talking to or referring to a man
gentleman.chi_def: 先生（對男士的禮貌稱呼）
gentleman.eg: Ladies and gentlemen, the show is about to begin.

gentleman.eng_def: a man who is polite and behaves well towards other people, especially women
gentleman.chi_def: （尤指對女性）彬彬有禮的男士，有教養的男人；君子

gentleman.eng_def: a man of a high social class
gentleman.chi_def: 上流社會的人，有身份的人；紳士

genuine.eng_def: If something is genuine, it is real and exactly what it appears to be.
genuine.chi_def: 真正的；非僞造的；名副其實的

genuine.eng_def: If people or emotions are genuine, they are honest and sincere.

genuine.eg: I'm genuinely sorry for what I said.

geographical.eng_def: relating to geography, or to the geography of a particular area or place

geography.eng_def: the study of the systems and processes involved in the world's weather, mountains, seas, lakes, etc. and of the ways in which countries and people organize life within an area
the way all the parts of an area are arranged within it
geography.chi_def: （某地的）地形，地貌；（某地區組成部分的）排列，佈局

geometry.eng_def: the area of mathematics relating to the study of space and the relationships between points, lines, curves, and surfaces
the way the parts of a particular object fit together
geometry.chi_def: 幾何形狀，幾何結構，幾何構造
geometry.eg: the geometry of a DNA molecule

germ.eng_def: a very small organism that causes disease
germ.eg: Wash your hands so you don't get germs on the food.

germ.eng_def: a small amount, usually one that develops into something large or important
germ.chi_def: （通常指發展成為巨大或重要事物）的發端，發源，萌芽
germ.eg: He found the germ of an idea in an old newspaper.

gesture.eng_def: a movement of the hands, arms, or head, etc. to express an idea or feeling
gesture.eg: The prisoner raised his fist in a gesture of defiance as he was led out of the courtroom.

gesture.eng_def: an action that expresses your feelings or intentions, although it might have little practical effect
gesture.eg: The government donated £500,000 as a gesture of goodwill.

gesture.eng_def: to use a gesture to express or emphasize something
gesture.chi_def: 做手勢；用手勢表示；用動作示意
gesture.eg: When he asked where the children were, she gestured vaguely in the direction of the beach.

get.eng_def: to obtain, buy, or earn something
get.chi_def: 獲得，得到；買到；賺得，贏得
get.eg: He went to the shop to get some milk.

get.eng_def: to receive or be given something
get.eg: I got quite a surprise when I saw her with short hair.

get.eng_def: to go somewhere and bring back someone or something
get.eg: Let me go get my glasses.

get.eng_def: to take someone or something into your possession by force
get.eg: Have the police got the man who did it yet?

get.eng_def: to reach or arrive at a particular place
get.eg: We hadn't even got as far as London when the car broke down.

get.eng_def: to reach a particular stage, condition, or time
get.chi_def: 達到（某個階段或者時間點）；處於（某種狀態）
get.eg: You earn loads of money if you get to the top in that profession.

get.eng_def: to make progress or to improve
get.chi_def: 有進步；獲得進展；有提高
get.eg: She's taking flute lessons, but she really doesn't seem to be getting anywhere with it.

get.eng_def: to become ill with a disease, virus, etc.
get.eg: I got food poisoning at that cheap little seafood restaurant.

get.eng_def: to become or start to be
get.eg: He gets really upset if you mention his baldness.

get.eng_def: to start to go or move
get.eg: We'd better get moving or we'll be late.

get.eng_def: to cause something to happen, or cause someone or something to do something
get.eg: She had to get the kids ready for school.

get.eng_def: to persuade someone to do something
get.eg: Why don't you get Nicole to come to the party?

get.eng_def: to do something to something or someone without intending to or by accident
get.eg: He got his bag caught in the train doors as they were closing.

get.eng_def: sometimes used instead of "be" to form the passive
get.chi_def: （有時代替 be 構成被動形式）變成，變得，被
get.eg: I got shouted at by some idiot for walking past his house.

get.eng_def: to move to a different place or into a different position
get.eg: I hit my head as I was getting into the car.

get.eng_def: to travel somewhere in a train, bus, or other vehicle
get.eg: Shall we get a taxi to the station?

get.eng_def: to deal with or answer a ringing phone, knock on the door, etc.
get.eg: Hey, Ty, someone's at the door - would you get it, please?

get.eng_def: to have the chance to do something
get.chi_def: 有機會（做…）；得到（做…的）機會
get.eg: I never get to see her now that she works somewhere else.

get.eng_def: to understand or hear something
get.eg: I didn't get what he said because the music was so loud.

get.eng_def: to prepare a meal
get.eg: I'll put the kids to bed while you're getting dinner ready.

get.eng_def: to pay for something
get.eg: Put your money away - I'll get these drinks.

get.eng_def: to confuse someone and make them completely unable to understand or explain
get.eg: Give him a technical question - that'll really get him!

get.eng_def: something that you say when you do not know the answer to a question
get.chi_def: 你把我難住了！我答不上來！
get.eg: "How many ounces in a kilo?" "You've got me there."

get.eng_def: to annoy someone
get.eg: It really gets to me the way we're expected to actually laugh at his pathetic jokes!

get.eng_def: to make someone feel strongly emotional and often cry
get.eg: That part in the film when he finds out that his daughter is alive - that always gets me!

get.eng_def: to hit someone, especially with a bullet or something thrown
get.chi_def: （尤指子彈或投擲的東西）擊中，打中
get.eg: The bullet got her in the leg.

ghost.eng_def: the spirit of a dead person, sometimes represented as a pale, almost transparent image of that person that some people believe appears to people who are alive
a memory, usually of something or someone bad
ghost.chi_def: （通常指對不好的事或人的）記憶，回憶；擺脫不掉的往事
ghost.eg: The ghost of the old dictator still lingers on.

giant.eng_def: an imaginary creature like a man but extremely tall, strong, and usually very cruel, appearing especially in children's stories
giant.chi_def: （尤指兒童故事中兇殘的）巨人

giant.eng_def: someone who is taller or larger than usual
giant.chi_def: 身材異常高大的人，巨人

giant.eng_def: a very successful and powerful person or organization
giant.chi_def: （成功且有影響的）偉人，巨頭，大公司
giant.eg: He was one of the intellectual/political giants of this century.

gift.eng_def: a present or something that is given
something that is surprisingly easy or cheap
gift.chi_def: 極容易完成的事；極便宜的東西

gift.eng_def: a special ability to do something
gift.eg: He has a gift for languages.

gift.eng_def: to give something in an official or formal way
gift.eg: The child's grandmother had gifted her £10,000.

gift.eng_def: to make it easy for an opponent to score, win, or be successful
gift.chi_def: 讓對手輕易地得分（取勝或成功）
gift.eg: She hit the ball into the net, almost gifting the set to her opponent.

gifted.eng_def: having special ability in a particular subject or activity
clever, or having a special ability
gifted.eg: Schools often fail to meet the needs of gifted children.

giggle.eng_def: to laugh repeatedly in a quiet but uncontrolled way, often at something silly or rude or when you are nervous
giggle.chi_def: （因為感到有趣、窘迫或緊張而）咯咯地笑，傻笑
giggle.eg: Stop that giggling in the back row!
There were a few nervous giggles from people in the audience.

giggle.eng_def: an occasion when you can't stop giggling
giggle.eg: I got the giggles in the lecture.

giggle.eng_def: something that is funny, often when it involves laughing at someone else
giggle.eg: Just for a giggle, we hid his trousers while he was in the water.

ginger.eng_def: the spicy root of a tropical plant that is used in cooking or preserved in sugar
a person who has red or orange-brown hair
ginger.eg: Hey, ginger, what are you doing?

ginger.eng_def: having a red or orange-brown colour
ginger.eg: His nickname was Ginger because of his ginger hair.

giraffe.eng_def: a large African animal with a very long neck and long legs

girl.eng_def: a female child or young woman, especially one still at school
girl.eg: Two girls showed us round the classrooms.

girl.eng_def: a woman worker, especially when seen as one of a group
girl.chi_def: （尤指被視作團隊一員的）女職員，女工

girl.eg: I'm going out with the girls tonight.

give.eng_def: to offer something to someone, or to provide someone with something
give.eg: She gave us a set of saucepans as a wedding present.

give.eng_def: to pay someone a particular amount
give.eg: I gave the taxi driver £20 and told him to keep the change.

give.eng_def: to give your money, time, or best efforts, especially in a way that seems generous
give.chi_def: （尤指慷慨地）獻出金錢／投入時間／付出最大努力（等等）
give.eg: We're very grateful to all the people who have given of their time.

give.eng_def: to put a lot of effort into doing something
give.chi_def: 全力以赴（做某事），不遺餘力（做某事）
give.eg: We must be finished by tonight, so I want you to give it your all.
The winner's name was given (out)/They gave the winner's name (out) on the news.

give.eng_def: to punish someone by sending them to prison for a particular period
give.eg: If you're found guilty, they'll give you three years.

give.eng_def: to allow a person or activity a particular amount of time
give.chi_def: 給…限定期限；限定，規定（時間）
give.eg: I'm nearly ready - just give me a couple of minutes.

give.eng_def: to calculate that something will last a particular amount of time
give.eg: Look at that old car she bought - I give it two weeks before it breaks down.
The fresh air gave us an appetite (= made us hungry).

give.eng_def: to tell someone something or cause someone to think that something is true
give.chi_def: 使（某人）知道（某事）；使（某人）相信（…確有其事）
give.eg: I was given to understand she was staying at this hotel.
She gave me a smile/strange look.

give.eng_def: to organize a party, meal, etc.

give.eg: Only a few people are successful as professional athletes, but it's worth giving it a go.

give.eng_def: to say publicly that everyone present at a formal occasion, especially a meal, should drink a toast to someone (= have a drink in honour of someone)
give.chi_def: （尤指在正式宴會上）提議為（某人）乾杯
give.eg: Ladies and Gentlemen, I give you the president!

give.eng_def: If something gives, it stretches, bends, or breaks, or becomes less firm or tight, under pressure.
give.chi_def: （在壓力下）伸長，彎曲，斷裂，變鬆
give.eg: The rope gave under/with the weight of the load.

give.eng_def: in some sports, to decide and state officially that a player or the ball is in a particular condition or place
give.chi_def: 裁定，判（球員或球所處的位置）
give.eg: The umpire gave the batsman out.

give.eng_def: the quality of stretching, bending, or breaking, or becoming less firm or tight, under pressure
give.chi_def: （在壓力下）伸長，彎曲，斷裂，變鬆
give.eg: A sweater knitted in pure cotton doesn't have much give (= will not stretch much).

glacier.eng_def: a large mass of ice that moves slowly

glad.eg: We were glad about her success.

glamour.eng_def: the special exciting and attractive quality of a person, place, or activity
glamour.eg: Who can resist the glamour of Hollywood?

glance.eng_def: to give a quick short look
glance.chi_def: 瞥一眼，迅速地看一眼，掃視
glance.eg: She glanced around/round the room to see who was there.

glance.eng_def: to shine, reflect light, or sparkle
glance.eg: The sunlight glanced on the lake.

glance.chi_def: 瞥一眼，迅速地看一眼，掃視
glance.eg: She took/cast a glance at her watch.
He could tell at a glance that something was wrong.
At first glance I thought it was a dog (but I was mistaken).

glare.eg: She gave me a fierce glare.
Tinted windows will reduce the glare/the sun's glare.
The sun was glaring right in my eyes.

glare.eng_def: to look directly and continuously at someone or something in an angry way
glare.eg: She glared angrily at everyone and stormed out of the room.

glass.eng_def: a hard, transparent material, used to make windows, bottles, and other objects
objects made from glass when thought of as a group
glass.eg: The museum has a fine collection of valuable glass.
In cool climates you have to grow tropical plants under glass.

glass.eng_def: a small container for drinks made of glass or similar material, with a flat base and usually with no handle
a type or amount of drink contained in a glass
glass.eg: Would you like a glass of water?

glass.eng_def: two small pieces of special glass or plastic in a frame worn in front of the eyes to improve sight

glass.eg: The glass has been falling/rising (= showing a change to bad/good weather) all day.

glasses.eng_def: a hard, transparent material, used to make windows, bottles, and other objects
objects made from glass when thought of as a group
glasses.eg: The museum has a fine collection of valuable glass.
In cool climates you have to grow tropical plants under glass.

glasses.eng_def: a small container for drinks made of glass or similar material, with a flat base and usually with no handle
a type or amount of drink contained in a glass
glasses.eg: Would you like a glass of water?

glasses.eng_def: two small pieces of special glass or plastic in a frame worn in front of the eyes to improve sight

glasses.eg: The glass has been falling/rising (= showing a change to bad/good weather) all day.

glassware.eng_def: drinking glasses or other objects made of glass
glassware.chi_def: 玻璃杯；玻璃器皿；玻璃製品

gleam.eng_def: to produce or reflect a small, bright light
gleam.eg: He polished the table until it gleamed.

gleam.eng_def: When eyes gleam, they shine in a way that expresses a particular emotion.

glee.eg: She opened her presents with glee.

glide.eng_def: to move easily without stopping and without effort or noise
glide.eg: She came gliding gracefully into the ballroom in a long, flowing gown.

glide.eng_def: to move or progress without difficulty or effort
glide.chi_def: 輕鬆行進；毫不費力地取得進展
glide.eg: Some people glide effortlessly through life with no real worries.

glide.eng_def: to fly by floating on air currents instead of using power from wings or an engine
glide.eg: We saw a condor gliding high above the mountains.

glimpse.eng_def: to see something or someone for a very short time or only partly
glimpse.eg: We glimpsed the ruined abbey from the windows of the train.

glimpse.eng_def: an occasion when you see something or someone for a very short time
glimpse.eg: I only caught (= had) a fleeting glimpse of the driver of the getaway car, but I know I would recognize her if I saw her again.

glimpse.eng_def: a quick idea or understanding of what something is like
glimpse.eg: This biography offers a few glimpses of his life before he became famous.

glisten.eng_def: to shine by reflecting light from a wet or smooth surface
glisten.chi_def: （因潮濕、油亮或光滑的表面反光而）閃光，閃耀，閃亮
glisten.eg: The grass glistened in the early-morning dew.

glitter.eng_def: to produce a lot of small, bright flashes of reflected light
glitter.eg: Her diamond necklace glittered brilliantly under the spotlights.

glitter.eng_def: If someone's eyes glitter, they look bright and express strong feeling.
glitter.eg: His dark eyes glittered with anger behind his glasses.

glitter.eng_def: the excitement and attractive quality connected with rich and famous people
glitter.chi_def: （富人或名人的）吸引力，魅力，誘惑力
glitter.eg: He was attracted by the glitter of Hollywood.

glitter.eng_def: very small pieces of shiny material used to decorate the skin or used by children to make pictures
glitter.chi_def: （裝飾或兒童作畫用的）小發光物，發光碎屑

global.eng_def: considering or relating to all parts of a situation or subject
global.eg: This report gives a global picture of the company's finances.

globe.eg: His greatest ambition is to sail around the globe.

globe.eng_def: a map of the world made in the shape of a ball and attached to a support, that can be turned around at the same angle as the earth turns in space
globe.eg: She spun the globe, and pointed to the Solomon Islands.

gloom.eng_def: feelings of great unhappiness and loss of hope
gloom.eg: Bergman's films are often full of gloom and despair.

gloom.eng_def: a situation in which it is nearly dark and difficult to see well
gloom.eg: She peered into the gloom, but she couldn't see where the noise was coming from.

gloomy.eng_def: not expecting or believing anything good in a situation
dark in a way that is unpleasant and makes it difficult to see

glorious.eng_def: deserving great admiration, praise, and honour

glorious.eg: The beetroot had turned the soup a glorious pink.

glorious.eng_def: Glorious weather is very pleasant, and especially hot and sunny.
glorious.chi_def: 令人愉快的，（尤指天氣）極好的
glorious.eg: They had glorious weather for their wedding.

glorious.eng_def: very enjoyable or giving great pleasure
glorious.chi_def: 極為怡人的；極其令人愉快的

glory.eng_def: praise and thanks, especially as given to God
glory.chi_def: （尤指對上帝的）讚頌，讚美，感激

glory.eng_def: great admiration, honour, and praise that you earn by doing something successfully
glory.eg: He revelled in the glory of scoring three goals in the final eight minutes.

glory.eng_def: an important achievement that earns someone great admiration, honour, and praise
glory.chi_def: 給人榮耀的事；值得稱讚的事；引以為豪的成就
glory.eg: The reunion is an opportunity for the soldiers to remember their past glories.

glory.eng_def: great beauty, or something special or extremely beautiful, that gives great pleasure
glory.eg: They want to restore the castle to its former glory.

glove.eng_def: a piece of clothing that is worn on the hand and wrist for warmth or protection, with separate parts for each finger
to put gloves on your hands
glove.eg: She gloved her hands to protect them from the chemicals.

glove.eng_def: to catch a ball when playing baseball
glove.chi_def: （棒球比賽中用戴手套的手）接（球）
glove.eg: He gloved the ball, turned and threw in one motion.

glow.eng_def: to produce a continuous light and sometimes heat
glow.eg: A nightlight glowed dimly in the corner of the children's bedroom.

glow.eng_def: to look attractive because you are happy or healthy, especially with eyes that are shining
glow.chi_def: （尤指因為眼睛放出光芒而）容光煥發，喜形於色
glow.eg: The children's faces were glowing with excitement.

glow.eng_def: to be hot or red from exercising
glow.eg: When we got back from our walk in the snow, my whole body was glowing.

glow.eng_def: continuous light and/or heat that is produced by something
the fact of your face feeling or appearing warm and healthy
glow.chi_def: 面部感覺（或顯得）溫暖健康
glow.eg: Like all the staff at the health club she had the healthy glow of the young and fit.
They felt a glow of pride as they watched their daughter collect the award.

glue.eng_def: a sticky substance that is used for joining things together permanently, produced from animal bones and skins or by a chemical process
to join things together using glue
glue.eg: Is it worth trying to glue this plate back together?

gnaw.eng_def: to bite or chew something repeatedly, usually making a hole in it or gradually destroying it
gnaw.chi_def: 咬，嚙，啃（通常指啃出孔洞或逐漸啃壞）
gnaw.eg: Babies like to gnaw hard objects when they're teething.

gnaw.eng_def: to make you feel worried or uncomfortable
gnaw.eg: I've been gnawed by guilt about not replying to her letter yet.

go.eng_def: to travel or move to another place
go.eg: We went into the house.

go.eng_def: to be in the process of moving
go.eg: Can't we go any faster?

go.eng_def: to move or travel somewhere in order to do something
go.eg: We go shopping every Friday night.

go.eng_def: said when you cannot find something
go.chi_def: （用於找不到東西時）…跑去哪裡了？
go.eg: Where have my keys gone?

go.eng_def: to leave a place, especially in order to travel to somewhere else
go.chi_def: （尤指為了去別的地方）離開，離去，出發
go.eg: Is it midnight already? I really must go/must be going.

go.eng_def: If you ask for some food to go at a restaurant, you want it wrapped up so that you can take it away with you instead of eating it in the restaurant.
go.chi_def: （將在飯店所點食物）帶走，外帶
go.eg: I'd like a cheeseburger and strawberry milkshake to go, please.

go.eng_def: polite word for to die
go.eg: She went peacefully in her sleep.

go.eng_def: If a road, path, etc. goes in a particular direction, it leads there.
go.eg: This road goes to Birmingham.

go.eng_def: to continue for a particular length
go.eg: The tree's roots go down three metres.

go.eng_def: to intend to do or be something in the future
go.chi_def: 將要做／成為；打算做／成為
go.eg: Are you going to go to Claire's party?

go.eng_def: to be certain or expected to happen in the future
go.chi_def: 肯定會做／成為；預期會做／成為
go.eg: They're going to have a baby in the spring.

go.eng_def: to become
go.eg: The idea of going grey doesn't bother me, but I'd hate to go bald.

go.eng_def: to move a part of the body in a particular way or the way that is shown
go.eg: Go like this with your hand to show that you're turning left.

go.eng_def: to operate (in the right way)
go.eg: Have you any idea why this watch won't go?

go.eng_def: If a period of time goes, it passes.
go.eg: I had a wonderful weekend but it went very quickly.

go.eng_def: to be or stay in a particular condition, especially an unpleasant one
go.chi_def: 處於（尤指令人不快的狀況）
go.eg: In spite of the relief effort, thousands of people continue to go hungry.

go.eng_def: in comparison with most other things of a particular type, especially when you do not think that type of thing is very good
go.chi_def: 就某類…而言，和一般…相比（尤指認為此類事物不太好）
go.eg: It was quite a good film, as horror films go.

go.eng_def: to prove that something is true
go.eg: Your daughter's attitude only goes to prove how much society has changed over the last 30 years.

go.eng_def: to start doing or using something
go.eg: I'll just connect the printer to the computer and then we'll be ready to go.

go.eng_def: to use your opportunity to play in a game
go.eg: It's your turn to go now.

go.eng_def: (of a number) to fit into another number especially resulting in a whole number
go.eg: 5 into 11 won't go.

go.eng_def: to say, especially when a story is being told
go.eg: "I never want to see you ever again," he goes, and storms out the house.

go.eng_def: to become weak or damaged, especially from being used (too much), or to stop working
go.chi_def: （尤指因為過度使用）變薄弱，衰退，損壞，垮掉
go.eg: After a gruelling six months singing on a world tour, it is hardly surprising that her voice is starting to go.

go.eng_def: to produce a noise
go.eg: I think I heard the doorbell go (= ring) just now.

go.eng_def: to be expressed, sung, or played
go.chi_def: 用某種措詞表達；（音樂）有某種調子；（以特定方式）唱
go.eg: I can never remember how that song goes.

go.eng_def: to happen or be found regularly or typically with each other or another
go.chi_def: 與（…）同時存在；與（…）相伴而生
go.eg: Wisdom and maturity don't necessarily go together.

go.eng_def: to be put in a particular place, especially as the usual place
go.chi_def: 被放置，被置於（尤指通常的位置）
go.eg: The sofa went against that wall before we had the radiator put in.

go.eng_def: to be sold or be available
go.chi_def: 被賣掉，被出售；現成可用
go.eg: The shop is having a closing-down sale - everything must go.

go.eng_def: to look or be acceptable or suitable
go.chi_def: 可以接受；匹配；適合；相稱
go.eg: That picture would go well on the wall in the living room.

go.eng_def: to be known (by a particular name)
go.chi_def: 被叫做，被稱為（某個名字或名稱）；名叫
go.eg: He had a scruffy old teddy bear that went by the name of Augustus.

go.eng_def: to develop or happen
go.eg: "How did the interview go?" "It went very well, thanks."

go.eng_def: an attempt to do something
go.eg: I've never done this before but I'll give it a go.

go.eng_def: to try to make something succeed, usually by working hard
go.chi_def: （通常指透過努力工作）使成功
go.eg: She's really making a go of her new antique shop.

go.eng_def: an opportunity to play in a game, or to do or use something
go.eg: Hey, it's Ken's go now! You've just had your go.

go.eng_def: to criticize someone
go.eg: My Dad's always having a go at me about getting a proper job.

go.eng_def: the condition of being energetic and active
go.eg: You're full of go this morning.

goal.eng_def: an area on a playing field, that usually has two posts with a net fixed behind them, where players try to send the ball in order to score in sports such as football and hockey
goal.eg: Black kicked/headed the ball into/towards the goal.

goal.eng_def: a point scored in some sports, such as football and hockey, when a player gets the ball into this area
goal.chi_def: （足球或曲棍球等的）射門，進球得分
goal.eg: Brazil won by three goals to one.

goal.eng_def: to be the player who tries to prevent the other team from scoring goals
goal.eg: Who is playing in goal for Milan this evening?

goal.eng_def: a goal area that has been left without any defenders
goal.chi_def: 球門大開（球門前沒有任何防守方隊員的射門機會）
goal.eg: Young rolled the ball across the six-yard box for Rooney to tap the ball into the open goal.
Our goal is for the country to be fully independent within two years.

goat.eng_def: an animal related to sheep that usually has horns and a beard. Goats live wild on mountains or are kept on farms to provide milk, meat, wool, etc.
a man who is very active sexually, or would like to be and makes it obvious
abbreviation for Greatest Of All Time: used to refer to or describe the person who has performed better than anyone else ever, especially in a sport
goat.chi_def: 史上最佳，史上最偉大 (Greatest Of All Time 的縮寫）
goat.eg: Mohammad Ali boxed his way into our hearts and will forever be known as GOAT, Greatest Of All Time.

gobble.chi_def: 狼吞虎嚥，大口大口地吃

gobble.eng_def: to make the sound of a male turkey

god.eng_def: a spirit or being believed to control some part of the universe or life and often worshipped for doing so, or something that represents this spirit or being
god.eg: the ancient Greek gods and goddesses

god.eng_def: someone who is very important to you, who you admire very much, and who strongly influences you
god.chi_def: （對某人來說）被極度尊崇的人，被崇拜的偶像
god.eg: His most devoted fans think of him as a sort of god.

god.eng_def: the seats in a theatre that are at the highest level and the furthest distance from the stage
god.chi_def: （劇院中的）頂層樓座，最高樓座

god.eng_def: (in some religions) the being who made the universe and is believed to have an effect on all things
god.chi_def: （尤指基督教、猶太教和伊斯蘭教中的）上帝，天主，真主

goddess.eg: Aphrodite was the ancient Greek goddess of love.

gold.eng_def: a chemical element that is a valuable, shiny, yellow metal used to make coins and jewellery
a small disc of gold that is given to the person who wins a competition, especially in a sport
gold.chi_def: （尤指體育競賽中授予的）金牌，金質獎章
gold.eg: He's running so well - surely he'll take the gold.

gold.eng_def: made of gold, or the colour of gold

golden.eng_def: special, successful, or giving someone an advantage
golden.chi_def: 特別的；非常有利的；成功的
golden.eg: the golden days of our youth

golf.eng_def: a game played outside on grass in which each player tries to hit a small ball into a series of nine or 18 small holes, using a long, thin stick
golf.eg: We often play a round (= game) of golf at the weekend.

goods.eng_def: very satisfactory, enjoyable, pleasant, or interesting
goods.chi_def: 令人滿意的；令人愉快的；合意的；有趣的
goods.eg: a good book

goods.eng_def: used in greetings
goods.chi_def: （用於打招呼）好
goods.eg: good morning/afternoon/evening

goods.eng_def: healthy or well
goods.chi_def: 健康的
goods.eg: I didn't go into work because I wasn't feeling too good.

goods.eng_def: used as a general reply when someone greets you
goods.chi_def: （用作別人向你問候時的回答語）我很好
goods.eg: "How are you doing?" "I'm good, thanks."

goods.eng_def: of a high quality or level
goods.chi_def: 好的；出色的；優質的
goods.eg: She speaks very good French.

goods.eng_def: used to express praise
goods.chi_def: （表示讚賞）好的，值得稱讚的
goods.eg: Good man! Splendid catch.

goods.eng_def: successful, or able to do something well
goods.chi_def: 成功的；能幹的；精通的；擅長的
goods.eg: Kate's a good cook.

goods.eng_def: to be of low quality or not useful
goods.chi_def: 劣質的；無用的
goods.eg: Shoes are no good if they let in water.

goods.eng_def: to begin an activity successfully
goods.chi_def: 有好的開始；順利開始
goods.eg: I didn't get off to a very good start this morning - I'd been at work five minutes and my computer stopped working!

goods.eng_def: kind or helpful
goods.chi_def: 好心的，心地善良的；樂於助人的
goods.eg: a good friend

goods.eng_def: used to make a polite request
goods.chi_def: 請（做…）
goods.eg: Be so good as to close the door when you leave.

goods.eng_def: to do something kind that helps someone else
goods.chi_def: 做（對某人）有利的事情

goods.eng_def: morally right or based on religious principles
goods.chi_def: 高尚的；虔誠的；好心的；助人為樂的
goods.eg: She led a good life.

goods.eng_def: having a positive or useful effect, especially on the health
goods.chi_def: （尤指在健康方面）有益的，有好處的，有用的
goods.eg: Make sure you eat plenty of good fresh food.

goods.eng_def: A good child or animal behaves well.
goods.chi_def: （兒童）乖的，守規矩的，不調皮的；（動物）溫順的
goods.eg: If you're a good boy at the doctor's, I'll take you swimming afterwards.

goods.eng_def: able to be trusted
goods.chi_def: 可信賴的；有信譽的；有信用的
goods.eg: Her credit is good (= she can be trusted to pay her debts).

goods.eng_def: suitable, convenient, or satisfactory
goods.chi_def: 合適的；方便的；令人滿意的
goods.eg: When would be a good time to phone?

goods.eng_def: used to emphasize the large number, amount, or level of something
goods.chi_def: 相當大的；相當多的；相當可觀的
goods.eg: We've walked a good distance today.

goods.eng_def: much
goods.chi_def: 大量；許多
goods.eg: The new law met with a good deal of opposition at the local level.

goods.eng_def: more than
goods.chi_def: 多於，超過
goods.eg: It's a good half hour's walk to the station from here.

goods.eng_def: said when you are satisfied or pleased about something, or to show agreement with a decision
goods.chi_def: （表示同意或滿意）好
goods.eg: Oh good, he's arrived at last.

goods.eng_def: used to tell someone that you have everything that you need
goods.chi_def: （用來告訴別人你需要的東西都齊了）都有了，不必了
goods.eg: "More coffee?" "No, I'm good, thanks."

goods.eng_def: things for sale, or the things that you own
goods.chi_def: 商品，貨物；私人財產
goods.eg: There is a 25 percent discount on all electrical goods until the end of the week.

goods.eng_def: things, but not people, that are transported by railway or road
goods.chi_def: （鐵路或公路）運載的貨物
goods.eg: a goods train

goods.eng_def: something that is an advantage or help to a person or situation
goods.chi_def: 好處；益處；用處
goods.eg: Even a small donation can do a lot of good.

goods.eng_def: the state of being healthy or in a satisfactory condition
goods.chi_def: 健康，健全；美滿；好處，益處
goods.eg: You should stop smoking for your own good (= for your health).

goods.eng_def: to improve someone's health or life
goods.chi_def: 有利（某人）的健康；對（某人）有好處；對（某人）有益處

goods.eng_def: that which is morally right
goods.chi_def: 善；符合道德的行為；正直的行為
goods.eg: There is an eternal struggle between good (= the force that produces morally right action) and evil.

goods.chi_def: 有道德的人；高尚的人；好人

goods.eng_def: for ever
goods.chi_def: 永久地，永遠地

goose.eng_def: a large water bird similar to a duck but larger, or the meat from this bird
to press or take hold of someone's bottom
goose.chi_def: 擰（某人）的臀部；戳（某人）的臀部

goose.eng_def: to encourage or cause something or someone to be more active

gorge.eng_def: a deep, narrow valley with steep sides, usually formed by a river or stream cutting through hard rock
gorge.chi_def: （通常指河流沖刷而成的）峽，峽谷

gorge.eng_def: to make someone feel shocked and angry
to eat until you are unable to eat any more

gorgeous.chi_def: 極其漂亮的，美麗動人的；令人愉快的

gorilla.eng_def: a large ape that comes from western Africa

gospel.eng_def: any of the four books of the Bible that contain details of the life of Jesus Christ
gospel.chi_def: 福音書（《聖經》中記載耶穌生平的四福音書之一）

gospel.chi_def: （用於強調某事的真實性）絕對真實

gospel.eng_def: a style of religious music originally performed by black Americans
gospel.chi_def: （起源於美國黑人中的）福音音樂

gospel.eng_def: a set of principles or ideas that someone believes in

gossip.eng_def: conversation or reports about other people's private lives that might be unkind, disapproving, or not true
gossip.chi_def: （有關別人隱私的）流言蜚語，閒言閒語，閒聊

gossip.eng_def: someone who enjoys talking about other people and their private lives
gossip.chi_def: 愛說三道四的人；喜歡散佈流言蜚語的人

gossip.eng_def: to talk about other people's private lives
gossip.chi_def: （對別人的隱私）說三道四，傳播流言蜚語

govern.eng_def: to control and direct the public business of a country, city, group of people, etc.
govern.eg: The country has been governed by military regimes.

govern.eng_def: to have a controlling influence on something
govern.eg: Prices of goods are governed by the cost of the raw materials, as well as by the cost of production and distribution.

government.eng_def: the group of people who officially control a country
the system used for controlling a country, city, or group of people
government.eg: The 1990s saw a shift to democratic government in Eastern Europe.

government.eng_def: the activities involved in controlling a country, city, group of people, etc.
government.eg: The party that was elected to power has no experience of government.

government.chi_def: 英國女王／國王陛下的政府，英國政府

governor.eng_def: a person in charge of a particular political unit
governor.chi_def: 統治者；管轄者；總督；州長

governor.eng_def: a person in charge of or responsible for a particular organization
governor.chi_def: （某組織機構的）董事，理事，主管

gown.eng_def: a woman's dress, especially a long one worn on formal occasions
gown.chi_def: （尤指正式場合穿的）女式禮服

gown.eng_def: a long, loose piece of clothing worn over other clothes for a particular purpose
gown.chi_def: （特定場合穿的）長袍，罩衣，長外衣

grab.eng_def: to take hold of something or someone suddenly and roughly

grab.eng_def: to take the opportunity to get, use, or enjoy something quickly
grab.chi_def: 抓住，利用（機會做某事）；（借機）趕緊…

grab.eng_def: a sudden attempt to hold, get, or take something

grace.eng_def: a quality of moving in a smooth, relaxed, and attractive way

grace.eng_def: the quality of being pleasantly polite, or a willingness to be fair and honest

grace.eng_def: ways of behaving that are considered polite and pleasant

grace.chi_def: （尤指上帝賜予人類的）恩典，恩寵

grace.chi_def: 承蒙上帝的恩典，上帝開恩

grace.eng_def: a prayer said by Christians before a meal to thank God for the food

grace.eng_def: a period of time left or allowed before something happens or before something must be done

grace.eng_def: to be in a place, on a thing etc. and make it look more attractive

grace.eng_def: to honour people by taking part in something
grace.chi_def: 光臨…而使之蓬篳生輝；蒞臨而為（某人）增光

grace.eng_def: used to address or refer to a duke, duchess or archbishop
grace.chi_def: 大人，閣下，夫人（對公爵、公爵夫人、女公爵或大主教的尊稱）

graceful.eng_def: moving in a smooth, relaxed, attractive way, or having a smooth, attractive shape

graceful.chi_def: 得體的，體面的；有風度的

gracious.eng_def: behaving in a pleasant, polite, calm way
gracious.chi_def: 慈祥的，和藹的；有禮貌的

gracious.eng_def: having the qualities of great comfort, beauty, and freedom made possible by being rich
used to express surprise or to emphasize what is being said
gracious.chi_def: （表示驚訝或用於強調語氣）天哪，老天爺，啊呀

grade.eng_def: a level of quality, size, importance, etc.

grade.eng_def: a number or letter that shows how good someone's work or performance is
grade.chi_def: 成績等級，評分等級，分數

grade.eng_def: a school class or group of classes in which all the children are of a similar age or ability
grade.eg: Jackie is in the sixth grade.

grade.eng_def: to separate people or things into different levels of quality, size, importance, etc.
grade.eg: The fruit is washed and then graded by size.

grade.eng_def: to give a score to a student's piece of work

gradual.eng_def: happening or changing slowly over a long period of time or distance
gradual.eg: There has been a gradual improvement in our sales figures over the last two years.

graduate.eng_def: a person who has a first degree from a university or college
graduate.chi_def: 大學畢業生，學士學位獲得者

graduate.eng_def: a person who has finished their school, college, or university education
to complete a first university degree successfully
graduate.chi_def: 取得學士學位，大學畢業

graduate.eng_def: to complete school, college, or university successfully
graduate.eg: After he graduated from high school, he joined the Army.

graduation.eng_def: the fact of finishing a degree or other course of study at a university or school, or the ceremony at which you are officially said to have finished
graduation.chi_def: 畢業；接受學位，獲得畢業文憑

grain.eng_def: a seed or seeds from a plant, especially a plant like a grass such as rice or wheat
grain.chi_def: （尤指像稻穀、小麥等像草一樣的植物的）穀粒，穎果，穀（物）

grain.eng_def: a very small piece of a hard substance
a very small amount of a particular quality
grain.eg: There wasn't a grain of truth in anything she said.

grain.eng_def: the pattern of extremely small spots of black and white or colour, that form a photographic or film image, or one of these small spots
the natural patterns of lines in the surface of wood or cloth

grain.eng_def: a unit of mass, equal to 0.0648 grams

gram.eng_def: a unit of mass equal to 0.001 kilograms

grammar.eng_def: (the study or use of) the rules about how words change their form and combine with other words to make sentences

grammatical.eng_def: relating to grammar or obeying the rules of grammar
grammatical.chi_def: 文法的；文法正確的，符合文法規則的

grand.eng_def: used in the name of a place or building to show that it is large or beautiful and deserves to be admired
grand.chi_def: （用在地方或建築物名前表示其規模）大的
極好的，出色的；快樂的，稱心的

John's new car cost him 20 grand!

grandchild.eng_def: the child of your son or daughter

granddaughter.eng_def: the daughter of a your son or daughter

grandfather.eng_def: the father of a person's mother or father
grandfather.eg: Her grandfather on her mother's side was Italian.

grandma.eg: I'm going to visit my grandma on Sunday.

grandmother.eng_def: the mother of a person's father or mother

grandson.eng_def: the son of a your son or daughter

grant.eng_def: an amount of money given especially by the government to a person or organization for a special purpose

grant.chi_def: （常指在表達相反的意見之前表示讓步）承認，同意

grape.eng_def: a small, round, purple or pale green fruit that you can eat or make into wine

graph.eng_def: a picture that shows how two sets of information or variables (= amounts that can change) are related, usually by lines or curves

grasp.eng_def: to quickly take something in your hand(s) and hold it firmly

grasp.chi_def: 急忙抓住，毫不猶豫地把握住（機會）

grasp.eng_def: the ability to get, achieve, or keep something

a person, usually a criminal, who tells the police about other criminals' activities
grass.chi_def: 告密者，通風報信者（通常指告發其同夥的罪犯）

grassy.chi_def: 覆蓋著青草的，長滿青草的

grateful.eng_def: showing or expressing thanks, especially to another person
grateful.chi_def: （尤指對其他人）感激的，表示感謝的

grave.eng_def: a place in the ground where a dead person is buried

gravity.eng_def: the force that attracts objects towards one another, especially the force that makes things fall to the ground

greasy.eng_def: covered with or full of fat or oil

great.eng_def: large in amount, size, or degree
used in names, especially to mean large or important

great.eng_def: larger in number or amount than

great.eng_def: famous, powerful, or important as one of a particular type
great.chi_def: 卓越的，偉大的，傑出的，重大的

great.chi_def: （用於表示某事非常糟糕）真絕

a famous person in a particular area of activity
used with a word for a family member to mean one generation away from that member
great.chi_def: （與表示家庭成員的詞連用，表示更高或更低一輩）曾

green.eng_def: of a colour between blue and yellow; of the colour of grass
relating to the protection of the environment
to do more to protect nature and the environment

green.eng_def: covered with grass, trees, and other plants
green.chi_def: 長滿綠色植物的，有綠色植物覆蓋的

green.eng_def: (especially of fruit) not ready to eat, or (of wood) not dry enough to use
green.chi_def: （尤指水果）不熟的，生的，青的；（木材）沒有乾的，濕的
缺乏經驗的；未經訓練的；不熟手的
green.eg: I was very green when I started working there.
What first struck her when she arrived in England was the greenness of the landscape.

green.eng_def: the colour of grass; a colour between blue and yellow
an area planted with grass, especially for use by the public

green.eng_def: used as a part of a name
a flat area of grass surrounding the hole on a golf course
green.chi_def: （高爾夫球場上的）球穴區，果岭

green.eng_def: the leaves of green vegetables such as spinach or cabbage when eaten as food
a member of the Green Party
green.eg: He used to be a Liberal, but now he's a Green.

greenhouse.eng_def: a building with a roof and sides made of glass, used for growing plants that need warmth and protection
greenhouse.eg: Gladys grows a lot of tomatoes in her greenhouse.

greet.eng_def: to welcome someone with particular words or a particular action, or to react to something in the stated way
greet.chi_def: 問候；迎接；向…打招呼；對…作出反應

greet.eng_def: If you are greeted by a sight, sound, or smell, you notice it immediately when you arrive somewhere.
greet.chi_def: 呈現在…眼前；傳入…的耳中；朝…撲面而來

greeting.eng_def: something friendly or polite that you say or do when you meet or welcome someone
greeting.eg: They briskly exchanged greetings before starting the session.

greeting.eng_def: a message that says you hope someone is well, happy, etc.

grey.eng_def: of the colour that is a mixture of black and white, the colour of rain clouds
having hair that has become grey or white, usually because of age

grey.eng_def: used to describe the weather when there are a lot of clouds and little light

grey.eng_def: the colour that is a mixture of black and white, the colour of rain clouds

grey.chi_def: （通常因年老而）頭髮變得灰白

grey.chi_def: 特定人群中年紀較大的人數增加，老齡化

grief.eng_def: very great sadness, especially at the death of someone

grieve.eng_def: to feel or express great sadness, especially when someone dies
grieve.chi_def: （尤指為某人去世而）悲痛，悲傷，傷心

grieve.eng_def: to make you feel sad and angry
grieve.eg: It grieves me to see all this food going to waste.

grill.eng_def: the surface in a cookerthat can be heated to very high temperatures and under which you put food to be cooked
a frame of metal bars over a fire on which food can be put to be cooked
an informal restaurant that sells grilled food such as hamburgers, steak, and chicken
to cook food over fire or hot coals, usually on a metal frame

grill.eng_def: to cook something under a very hot surface in a cooker
grill.chi_def: （將食物置於烤箱中溫度極高的炙烤架下）燒烤，烤制

grill.eng_def: to ask someone a lot of questions for a long time

grim.chi_def: 令人擔憂的，令人沮喪的

grim.eg: Her face was grim as she told them the bad news.

grim.chi_def: 令人不快的，討厭的；醜陋的

grin.eg: I assumed things had gone well for him because he had a big grin on his face.
He grinned at me from the doorway.

grind.eng_def: to make something into small pieces or a powder by pressing between hard surfaces
to rub something against a hard surface, in order to make it sharper or smoother
grind.eg: She has a set of chef's knives that she grinds every week.

grind.eng_def: to make a noise by rubbing your teeth together
grind.chi_def: 把牙齒咬得嘎嘎響；出聲地磨牙
grind.eg: She grinds her teeth in her sleep.

grind.eng_def: a difficult or boring activity that needs a lot of effort
grind.chi_def: 令人厭倦的苦事，苦差事

grind.eng_def: a boring person who studies all the time and does nothing else
grind.chi_def: 只會讀書的無趣之人，書呆子

grip.eg: The baby gripped my finger with her tiny hand.

grip.eng_def: When an emotion such as fear grips you, you feel it strongly.
grip.chi_def: （感情等）強烈地控制；對…產生強烈影響

grip.eng_def: a tight hold on something or someone

grip.eng_def: a bag for travelling that is smaller than a suitcase

groan.eng_def: a deep, long sound showing great pain or unhappiness
groan.chi_def: （表示痛苦的）呻吟聲；（表示不高興的）哼哼聲，嘆息聲

groan.eng_def: to make a deep, long sound showing great pain or unhappiness
groan.chi_def: （表示痛苦的）呻吟聲；（表示不高興的）哼哼聲，嘆息聲

groan.eg: She's always moaning and groaning (= complaining a lot) about the weather.

grocer.eng_def: a person who owns or works in a shop selling food and small things for the home
grocer.chi_def: 食品雜貨店店主（或店員）

grocery.eng_def: the food that you buy in a grocer's shop or supermarket

groom.eng_def: to clean an animal, often by brushing its fur
groom.eg: Polly spends hours in the stables grooming her pony.

groom.eng_def: to prepare someone for a special job or activity
groom.eg: She was being groomed for leadership.

groom.eng_def: to become friends with a child, especially over the internet, with the intention of committing a sexual offence
groom.chi_def: （尤指透過網際網路）勾引，誘騙，誘姦（兒童）

groom.eg: The bride and groom walked down the aisle together.

groom.eng_def: a person whose job is to take care of and clean horses

grope.eng_def: to feel with your hands, especially in order to find or move towards something when you cannot see easily
grope.chi_def: 摸索；（尤指）摸尋，探尋，摸索著前進

grope.eng_def: to touch someone's body in order to get sexual pleasure, usually when the person does not like it
grope.eg: He groped me as I was going to the bar.

grope.eng_def: a sexual touch, usually an unwanted and unpleasant one

gross.eg: A person's gross income is the money they earn before tax is deducted from it.

gross.chi_def: 極其令人厭惡的，令人噁心的，令人不快的
gross.eg: "Oh, gross!" she said, looking at the flies buzzing above the piles of dirty plates.

gross.eng_def: extremely fat or large and ugly
gross.chi_def: 臃腫難看的；龐大不雅觀的
gross.eg: I'd put on ten kilos and felt gross in my bikini.

gross.eng_def: (especially in law) unacceptable because clearly wrong
gross.chi_def: （尤指違法行為）嚴重的，惡劣的，極端的，不能接受的

gross.eng_def: to earn a particular amount of money before tax is paid or costs are taken away
gross.chi_def: 總收入為，總共賺得，獲得…毛利
gross.eg: The film has grossed over $200 million this year.

ground.eg: I sat down on the ground.

ground.eng_def: an area of land used for a particular purpose or activity
the gardens and land that surround a building and often have a wall or fence around them
ground.chi_def: （常由牆或柵欄圍起來的建築物周圍的）庭院，場地，花園
ground.eg: We went for a walk around the hospital grounds.
She is suing the company on grounds of unfair dismissal.

ground.eng_def: an area of knowledge or experience
ground.chi_def: （知識、經驗等的）領域，範圍；學科
ground.eg: When the conversation turns to politics he's on familiar ground (= he knows a lot about this subject).

ground.eng_def: a wire that makes a connection between a piece of electrical equipment and the ground, so the user is protected from feeling an electric shock if the equipment develops a fault
the small grains of coffee left at the bottom of a cup or other container that has had coffee in it
past simple and past participle of grind
If a ship is grounded, it cannot move because it has hit solid ground.
ground.eg: The oil tanker was grounded on a sandbank.

ground.eng_def: If aircraft are grounded, they are prevented from flying or ordered not to fly.
ground.eg: The snowstorm meant that all planes were grounded.

ground.eng_def: to forbid (= refuse to allow) a child or young person from going out as a punishment
ground.eg: My parents grounded me for a week.

ground.eng_def: to connect a piece of electrical equipment to the ground with a wire
ground.eg: You could get a nasty shock from that water heater if it isn't grounded properly.

ground.eng_def: to be based firmly on something
ground.eg: Fiction should be grounded in reality.

group.eng_def: a number of people or things that are put together or considered as a unit
group.eg: I'm meeting a group of friends for dinner tonight.

group.eng_def: a number of people who play music together, especially pop music
group.chi_def: （尤指流行音樂）樂團，樂隊，組合

group.eng_def: a business that contains several different companies
group.eg: United News Media, the national newspaper and television group

group.eng_def: a number of football teams who play each other in a competition. The winners of the group move onto the next stage of the competion
group.eg: The Danes were the surprise winners of their group.

group.eng_def: the first part of a football competition in which teams are divided into groups and play only the other teams in their group. The winners of each group move onto the next stage of the competition
group.eg: The team failed to progress beyond the group stages of Euro 2012.

group.eng_def: to form a group or put people or things into a group
group.eg: We all grouped together around the bride for a family photograph.

grow.eng_def: to increase in size or amount, or to become more advanced or developed
grow.chi_def: 增多；增大；增強；增長；成長；長大

grow.eng_def: If your hair or nails grow, or if you grow them, they become longer.
grow.eg: Lottie wants to grow her hair long.

grow.eng_def: If a plant grows in a particular place, it exists and develops there.
grow.eg: There were roses growing up against the wall.

grow.eng_def: If you grow a plant, you put it in the ground and take care of it, usually in order to sell it.
grow.chi_def: （通常指為了出售而）栽培，種植
grow.eg: The villagers grow coffee and maize to sell in the market.

grow.eng_def: to make a business bigger by increasing sales, employing more people, etc.
grow.eg: We aim to grow the company by giving the customer a better deal.

grow.eng_def: to gradually become tired, old, calm, etc.
grow.chi_def: 變得疲勞／老邁／安靜（等等）
grow.eg: He grew bored of the countryside.

grow.eng_def: to gradually start to do something
grow.eg: I've grown to like her over the months.

growl.eng_def: to make a low, rough sound, usually in anger
growl.chi_def: （通常指因為憤怒）發出低沉的吼叫，咆哮
growl.eg: The dog growled at her and snapped at her ankles.

growth.eng_def: The growth of a person, animal, or plant is its process of increasing in size.
growth.eg: A balanced diet is essential for healthy growth.

growth.eng_def: an increase in the size or the importance of something
growth.eg: The government is trying to limit population growth.

growth.eng_def: a lump (= a solid mass) growing on the outside or inside of a person, animal, or plant that is caused by a disease
growth.chi_def: （疾病引起的體內或體外的）腫塊，腫瘤，贅生物
growth.eg: a cancerous growth on the liver
Graham came back from the camping trip with a week's growth of beard on his chin.

grumble.eng_def: to complain about someone or something in an annoyed way
grumble.eg: She spent the evening grumbling to me about her job.

grumble.eng_def: If your stomach grumbles, it makes a low, continuous noise, usually because you are hungry.
a person who complains a lot
grumble.chi_def: 牢騷滿腹的人，總是抱怨的人

grumble.eg: When the teacher assigned extra homework, she heard a few grumbles from the kids.

guarantee.eng_def: a promise that something will be done or will happen, especially a written promise by a company to repair or change a product that develops a fault within a particular period of time
guarantee.chi_def: 保證；（尤指公司保證對產品保修或包退的）保修單，包換單
guarantee.eg: The system costs £99.95 including shipping and handling and a twelve-month guarantee.

guarantee.eng_def: a formal agreement to take responsibility for something, such as the payment of someone else's debt
something valuable that you give to someone temporarily while you do what you promised to do for them, and that they will keep if you fail to do it
If a product is guaranteed, the company that made it promises to repair or change it if a fault develops within a particular period of time.
guarantee.eg: The fridge is guaranteed for three years.

guarantee.eng_def: to promise that something will happen or exist
guarantee.eg: European Airlines guarantees its customers top-quality service.

guarantee.eng_def: If you guarantee someone's debt, you formally promise to accept the responsibility for that debt if the person fails to pay it.
guarantee.chi_def: 為…作保；擔保；承諾對…負法律責任

guarantee.eng_def: If something guarantees something else, it makes certain that it will happen.
guarantee.eg: The £50 deposit guarantees (that) people return the boats after their hour has finished.

guarantee.eng_def: If something is guaranteed to happen or have a particular result, it is certain that it will happen or have that result.
guarantee.chi_def: 肯定…必然發生；肯定會有某種結果
guarantee.eg: Just looking at a picture of the sea is guaranteed to make me feel sick.

guard.eng_def: a person or group of people whose job is to protect a person, place, or thing from danger or attack, or to prevent a person such as a criminal from escaping
to be kept in a place by a group of people who have weapons
guard.chi_def: 處於武裝人員的保護（或守衛）之下
guard.eg: The ex-president was under armed guard in the palace.

guard.eng_def: to be responsible for protecting someone or something, or for preventing someone from escaping
guard.eg: Two of the soldiers kept guard over the captured guns.

guard.eng_def: a ceremony held outside Buckingham Palace in London, where one set of soldiers replaces the soldiers who have finished their time on duty standing outside the palace
guard.chi_def: 白金漢宮皇家衛隊換崗（儀式）

guard.eng_def: a railway official who travels on and is responsible for a train
a device that protects a dangerous part of something or that protects something from getting damaged
guard.chi_def: 保護裝置；保護用品；保護器

guard.eng_def: to protect someone or something from being attacked or stolen
guard.eg: Soldiers guard the main doors of the embassy.

guard.eng_def: to watch someone and make certain they do not escape from a place
guard.eg: Five prison officers guarded the prisoners.
Journalists jealously (= carefully) guard their sources of information.

guard.chi_def: 國民警衛隊（the National Guard的非正式說法）

guardian.eng_def: a person who has the legal right and responsibility of taking care of someone who cannot take care of himself or herself, such as a child whose parents have died
guardian.eg: The child's parents or guardians must give their consent before she has the operation.
These three official bodies are the guardians of the nation's countryside.

guava.eng_def: a round yellow tropical fruit with pink or white flesh and hard seeds, or the small tropical tree on which it grows

guerrilla.eng_def: a member of an unofficial military group that is trying to change the government by making sudden, unexpected attacks on the official army forces
guerrilla.eg: A small band of guerrillas has blown up a train in the mountains.

guerrilla.eng_def: using unusual methods to get attention for your ideas, products, etc.

guess.eng_def: to give an answer to a particular question when you do not have all the facts and so cannot be certain if you are correct
guess.eg: I didn't know the answer, so I had to guess.

guess.eng_def: to give the correct answer or make the correct judgment
guess.eg: I bet you can't guess how old he is.

guess.eng_def: used before telling someone something interesting or surprising
guess.chi_def: （用來告訴某人有趣或令人驚奇的事情）你猜怎麼著?
guess.eg: Guess what? We won the game 4–0.

guess.eng_def: used when you believe something is true or likely but are not certain
guess.eg: I guess (that) things are pretty hard for you now.

guess.eng_def: an attempt to give the right answer when you are not certain if you are correct
someone's opinion about something that is formed without any knowledge of the situation
guess.eg: "I wonder why she's not here." "My guess is that her car has broken down."

guess.eng_def: If a piece of information is anyone's guess, no one knows it.
guess.chi_def: 誰也不知道，誰也拿不準
guess.eg: "So what's going to happen now?" "That's anyone's guess."

guest.eng_def: a person who is staying with you, or a person you have invited to a social occasion, such as a party or a meal
guest.eg: 150 guests were invited to the wedding.

guest.eng_def: a person who is staying in a hotel
guest.eg: We would like to remind all our guests to leave their keys at reception before they depart.

guest.eng_def: a person, such as an entertainer, who has been invited to appear on a television or radio programme or in a performance
guest.chi_def: （廣播電視節目中的）特邀嘉賓，特別來賓；客串演員
guest.eg: Our special guest on the programme tonight is Robert de Niro.

guest.eng_def: If a person, especially an entertainer, guests on a programme or show, they are invited to appear or perform on it.
guest.chi_def: （尤指娛樂演員）當特約演員，作為特約演員參加
guest.eg: He guests on their latest video.

guidance.eng_def: help and advice about how to do something or about how to deal with problems connected with your work, education, or personal relationships
guidance.eg: I've always looked to my father for guidance in these matters.

guidance.eng_def: the process of directing the flight of a missile or rocket

guide.eng_def: a book that gives you the most important information about a particular subject
something that helps you form an opinion or make a decision about something else
guide.chi_def: 指導性的事物，準則，根據
guide.eg: I never follow recipes exactly when I cook - I just use them as rough guides.

guide.eng_def: a person whose job is showing a place or a particular route to visitors
guide.eg: We hired a guide to take us up into the mountains.

guide.eng_def: a person or thing that influences what you do or think
guide.chi_def: 有影響作用的人（或事物）
guide.eg: Let your conscience be your guide.

guide.eng_def: to show someone how to do something difficult
guide.chi_def: 指導，指引（做困難的事情）
guide.eg: Our lawyer guided us through the more complicated questions on the form.

guide.eng_def: to show people around a place
guide.chi_def: 給…導遊，帶…參觀，領…四處看
guide.eg: The curator guided us through the gallery, pointing out the most famous paintings in the collection.

guide.eng_def: to take someone somewhere or to show someone how to get somewhere
guide.eg: The shop assistant guided me to the shelf where the gardening books were displayed.

guide.eng_def: to take hold of part of someone's body, especially their arm, and take that person somewhere
guide.chi_def: （尤指抓著某人的胳膊）帶…去，領…到，攙扶…去
guide.eg: He took my arm and guided me to the bar.

guide.eng_def: to make something move in the direction in that you want it to go
guide.chi_def: 操控，駕駛，（朝某個方向）移動（某物）
guide.eg: The pilot guided the plane onto the runway.
Trust your own judgment and don't be guided by what anyone else thinks.

guide.eng_def: a girl between ten and 14 years old who is a member of the Guides organization
an international organization for young women that encourages them to take part in different activities and to become responsible and independent

guideline.eng_def: information intended to advise people on how something should be done or what something should be
guideline.chi_def: 指導方針，指導原則，準則
guideline.eg: The EU has issued guidelines on appropriate levels of pay for part-time manual workers.

guilt.eng_def: a feeling of worry or unhappiness that you have because you have done something wrong, such as causing harm to another person
guilt.eg: He suffered such feelings of guilt over leaving his children.

guilt.eng_def: the fact of having done something wrong or committed a crime
guilt.eg: Both suspects admitted their guilt to the police.

guilty.eg: I feel so guilty about forgetting her birthday.

guilty.chi_def: 有過失的，犯了罪的，有罪責的
guilty.eg: The jury has to decide whether a person is guilty or innocent of a crime.

guilty.eng_def: the person who has done something wrong or who has committed a crime
guilty.chi_def: 有過錯的一方；犯罪的一方

guitar.eng_def: a musical instrument, usually made of wood, with six strings and a long neck, played with the fingers or a plectrum
guitar.eg: He sat on the grass, strumming his guitar.

gulf.eng_def: a very large area of sea surrounded on three sides by a coast
the Persian Gulf and the countries around it
gulf.chi_def: 波斯灣；波斯灣各國；海灣國家
gulf.eg: The Gulf states include Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Bahrain, Oman, Qatar, and the UAE.

gulf.eng_def: a very large, deep hole in the ground
an important difference between the ideas, opinions, or situations of two groups of people
gulf.chi_def: 不可逾越的鴻溝，巨大的差距；隔閡
gulf.eg: There is a widening gulf between the rich and the poor in our society.

gull.eng_def: a bird that lives near the coast with black and white or grey and white feathers

gulp.eng_def: to eat or drink food or liquid quickly by swallowing it in large amounts, or to make a swallowing movement because of fear, surprise, or excitement
gulp.chi_def: 大口地吃（或喝）；（因為害怕、吃驚、激動等）倒吸氣，喘不過氣來
gulp.eg: She gulped down her drink and made a hasty exit.

gulp.eng_def: to breathe in a large amount of air very quickly

gulp.eg: He swallowed his drink in one gulp.

gum.eng_def: either of the two areas of firm pink flesh inside the mouth that cover the bones into which the teeth are fixed
a sticky substance that comes from the stems of some trees and plants
a type of glue used for sticking together pieces of paper
chewing gum  or  bubble gum  (= a soft sweet that you crush with your teeth but do not swallow)
gum.chi_def: 口香糖（同 chewing gum）；泡泡糖（同 bubble gum）

gum.eng_def: used in the names of some chewy sweets with fruit flavours
gum.chi_def: 透明果味糖；膠姆糖；橡皮軟糖

gum.eng_def: If you gum one piece of paper to another, you stick them together using glue.
gum.eg: The labels were already gummed to the envelopes.

gun.eng_def: a weapon that bullets or shells (= explosive containers) are fired from
gun.eg: The British police do not carry guns.

gun.eng_def: in sport, a device that makes a very loud sudden noise as a signal to start a race
gun.chi_def: （體育比賽中用來表示比賽開始的）信號槍
gun.eg: At the gun, the runners sprinted away down the track.

gun.eng_def: a device that you hold in your hand and use for sending out a liquid or object
a person who is paid to shoot and kill someone
to make an engine operate at a higher speed
gun.eg: You must have been really gunning the engine to get here on time.

gust.eg: A sudden gust of wind blew his umbrella inside out.
Winds gusting to 50 mph brought down power lines.

gut.eng_def: the long tube in the body of a person or animal, through which food moves during the process of digesting food
gut.eg: Meat stays in the gut longer than vegetable matter.

gut.eng_def: a person's stomach when it is extremely large
gut.eg: He's got a huge beer gut (= large stomach caused by drinking beer).

gut.eng_def: a strong thread made from an animal's bowels used, especially in the past, for making musical instruments and sports rackets
gut.chi_def: （尤指舊時用來製作樂器和球拍的）腸線

gut.eng_def: a strong belief about someone or something that cannot completely be explained and does not have to be decided by reasoning
gut.eg: I have a gut feeling that the relationship won't last.

gut.eng_def: a way of deciding what should be done or what is right, that is based on how someone feels rather than thinking about reasons
gut.chi_def: 憑直覺，憑感情（決定或判斷）
gut.eg: My head said that I should go but my gut said I should stay.

gut.eng_def: courage in dealing with danger or uncertainty
gut.eg: It takes a lot of guts to admit to so many people that you've made a mistake.

gut.eng_def: to destroy the inside of a building completely, usually by fire
gut.chi_def: （通常指火災）徹底損毀（房屋）的內部
gut.eg: A fire gutted the bookshop last week.

gut.eng_def: to remove the inside parts and contents of a building, usually so that it can be decorated in a completely new way
gut.chi_def: （通常指為了裝修）拆除（房屋）的內部

gut.eng_def: to remove the inner organs of an animal, especially in preparation for eating it
gut.eg: She gutted the fish and cut off their heads.

guy.eng_def: used to address a group of people of either sex
guy.chi_def: （用於稱呼不論男女的一群人）大家，各位，夥計們
guy.eg: Come on, you guys, let's go.

guy.eng_def: in the UK, a model of a man that is burned on a large fire on Guy Fawkes Night
guy.chi_def: 蓋伊‧福克斯之夜（11月5日，英國人在這天晚上焚燒蓋伊‧福克斯模擬像並放煙花以紀念挫敗1605年蓋伊‧福克斯企圖炸毀英國議會的陰謀）

guy.eng_def: a rope that at one end is connected to a tent or pole and at the other end is fastened to the ground by a peg, keeping the tent or pole in position
guy.chi_def: （一頭拴住帳篷或帳篷支撐杆，另一頭固定在地上的）固定拉繩，牽索，支索

gym.eng_def: physical exercises and activities performed inside, often using equipment, especially when done as a subject at school
gym.chi_def: （尤指作為學校課程的）體操，健身操

gym.eng_def: a large room with equipment for exercising the body and increasing strength
gym.eg: We played basketball in the gym.

gym.eng_def: a club where you can go to exercise and keep fit
gym.eg: I go to the gym twice a week.

gymnasium.eng_def: a large room with equipment for exercising the body and increasing strength

gypsy.eng_def: a member of a race of people originally from northern India who typically used to travel from place to place, and now live especially in Europe and North America

habit.eng_def: something that you do often and regularly, sometimes without knowing that you are doing it
habit.eg: I always buy the same brand of toothpaste out of (= because of) habit.

habit.eng_def: something annoying that someone often does
habit.eg: She has a habit of finishing off other people's sentences.

habit.eng_def: a strong physical need to keep taking a particular drug
a special piece of long clothing worn by monks and nuns

habitat.eng_def: the natural environment in which an animal or plant usually lives
habitat.eg: With so many areas of woodland being cut down, a lot of wildlife is losing its natural habitat.

hack.eng_def: to cut into pieces in a rough and violent way, often without aiming exactly
hack.eg: Three villagers were hacked to death in a savage attack.

hack.eng_def: in football and rugby, to kick the ball away or to foul (= act against the rules) by kicking another player in the leg
hack.chi_def: （足球或橄欖球運動中）將（球）踢出；踢（人）犯規
hack.eg: He was twice hacked down in the second half by the other team's sweeper.

hack.eng_def: to get into someone else's computer system without permission in order to find out information or do something illegal
hack.chi_def: 未經允許侵入他人的電腦系統（來竊取資訊或從事非法勾當）
hack.eg: Computer hacking has become widespread over the last decade.

hack.eng_def: to use someone else's phone system without permission, especially to listen to their spoken messages
hack.chi_def: 未經允許侵入他人的電話系統（特別是用來竊聽對話）
hack.eg: Police told the actor that his phone had been hacked.

hack.eng_def: to manage to deal successfully with something
hack.eg: I tried working on the night shift for a while, but I just couldn't hack it.

hack.eng_def: to ride a horse for pleasure
a journalist (= writer for newspapers or magazines) whose work is low in quality or does not have much imagination
hack.chi_def: 僱用文人，捉刀者， 寫手（指受僱爲報刊撰寫庸俗文章者）

hack.eng_def: a politician, especially one who is not important
a ride on a horse in the countryside
(the driver of) a car that is available for rent, especially a taxi
hack.chi_def: 供出租的汽車；計程車司機

hack.eng_def: a good solution or piece of advice
hack.eg: Here are 50 life hacks that will change your life for the better.

hacker.eng_def: someone who hacks into other people's computer systems
hacker.chi_def: 駭客，非法侵入他人電腦者

hacker.eng_def: someone who hacks into another person's phone and listens to their messages
hacker.chi_def: 駭客，侵入他人電話竊聽對話者

hail.eng_def: small, hard balls of ice that fall from the sky like rain
a lot of similar things or remarks, thrown or shouted at someone at the same time
to call someone in order to attract their attention
If it hails, small, hard balls of ice fall from the sky like rain.

hair.eng_def: the mass of thin thread-like structures on the head of a person, or any of these structures that grow out of the skin of a person or animal
hair.chi_def: （人的）頭髮；（人或動物的）汗毛，毛髮

haircut.eng_def: the style in which someone's hair is cut, or an occasion of cutting the hair
haircut.eg: She has a really awful haircut.

haircut.eng_def: a reduction in an amount of money, such as the price of a share or bond
haircut.chi_def: 金錢損失（例如由於股票或債券價格下跌）；削債
haircut.eg: The crisis means that lenders will have to take a haircut (= accept that they have lost money because the value of the investment has gone down).

hairdo.eng_def: the style in which a person, especially a woman, has their hair cut and arranged, especially if it is unusual or done for a particular occasion
hairdo.chi_def: （尤指女性的）髮型，髮式（尤指別出心裁的或爲某一特殊場合而做的髮型）
hairdo.eg: She had a very elaborate hairdo, all piled up on top of her head.

hairdresser.eng_def: a person who cuts people's hair and puts it into a style, usually working in a special shop, called a hairdresser's
hairdresser.eg: I'm going to change my hairdresser.

hairstyle.eng_def: the style in which someone's hair is cut and arranged

half.eng_def: either of the two equal or nearly equal parts that together make up a whole

half.eg: She invited a lot of people to the party but half of them didn't turn up.

half.eng_def: Half past a particular hour is 30 minutes later than that hour.
half.eg: I'll meet you at half past nine (= 09.30 or 21.30).
He answered the door half naked.

half.eng_def: to divide the cost of something with someone
half.eg: Shall we go halves on a bottle of champagne?

half.eng_def: equal amounts of two different things
half.eg: You can use just sugar, just honey, or half and half.

half.eng_def: 50 percent more of the existing number or amount
either of two periods of time into which a game is divided
half a pint of a drink, especially beer
half.eg: A pint of lager and two halves, please.

half.eng_def: a ticket that is cheaper because it is for a child
half.eg: Two (adults) and three halves to Manchester, please.

hall.eng_def: the room just inside the main entrance of a house, apartment, or other building that leads to other rooms and usually to the stairs
hall.eg: I left my bags in the hall.

hall.eng_def: a building or large room used for events involving a lot of people

halt.eng_def: to (cause to) stop moving or doing something or happening
halt.eg: "Halt!" called the guard. "You can't go any further without a permit."

halt.eng_def: an occasion when something stops moving or happening

halt.eg: How many more people will have to die before they call a halt to the fighting?

ham.eng_def: pig's meat from the leg or shoulder, preserved with salt or smoke
an actor whose style of acting is artificial and old-fashioned, often using movements and emotions that are too obvious
ham.chi_def: （風格做作老套且表演過火的）拙劣演員
ham.eg: They had some dreadful old ham in the main part.
